title: Rate law of NO2 and Cl2 - rate change double conc.

content.question: The rate law for the reaction of nitrogen dioxide and chlorine is found to be rate = k [NO2]2[Cl2]. By what factor does the rate of the reaction change when the concentrations of both NO2 and Cl2 are doubled?

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
